Class PuzzleState

  • java.lang.Object
    • PuzzleState

  • public class PuzzleState
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a state (placement of tiles) of the puzzle. Starter code.
    Author:
    Steven Bogaerts

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PuzzleState(int[] initialTiles)
      Assumes that initialTiles is the valid format: length 9, containing the integers 0 through 8 inclusive in some order with no repeats where 0 represents the blank.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
      Returns true if two PuzzleState objects are equivalent, false otherwise.
      java.util.LinkedList<PuzzleState> expand()
      Returns a list of PuzzleStates that can be reached from this PuzzleState in one move.
      int getTileAt(int index)
      Returns the tile value at the given index (0 through 8, inclusive).
      int posOf(int tile)
      Returns the position of a given tile in the puzzle state.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a String representation of the state.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • PuzzleState

        public PuzzleState(int[] initialTiles)
        Assumes that initialTiles is the valid format: length 9, containing the integers 0 through 8 inclusive in some order with no repeats where 0 represents the blank.

    • Method Detail

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object other)
        Returns true if two PuzzleState objects are equivalent, false otherwise. Required for proper operation of a HashSet of PuzzleStates.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • expand

        public java.util.LinkedList<PuzzleState> expand()
        Returns a list of PuzzleStates that can be reached from this PuzzleState in one move. It's easiest to think of this as moving the blank.

      • getTileAt

        public int getTileAt(int index)
        Returns the tile value at the given index (0 through 8, inclusive).

      • posOf

        public int posOf(int tile)
        Returns the position of a given tile in the puzzle state. Returns -1 if not found. (Should never happen for valid input.)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String representation of the state.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
